office: Democratic Staff of the House Committee on Small Business
key_responsibilities: hearing preparation
legislative development
outreach and engagement to key stakeholders and interest groups
requirements: exposure to small business policy and SBA programs a plus

key_responsibilities: answer incoming calls and distribute requests for advice among office attorneys
assist with personnel/human relations matters and ensure that office policies and procedures are followed
maintain office finance and payroll accounts in accordance with applicable House regulations and office policies
assist with annual budgeting process
procure and maintain software, equipment, office supplies, and library for the office
serve as point of contact for IT-related issues for the office, perform IT-related tasks, and coordinate with HIR and outside computer vendors as needed
perform general administrative tasks as needed
requirements: at least three years of office management experience
at least two years of experience working in a congressional office
ability to manage multiple tasks and projects and to work well under pressure
familiarity with House Rules, policies, and procedures relating to use of appropriated funds, purchasing, budgeting, payroll, personnel, and management of IT resources
thoroughness and careful attention to detail

office: House Democrat and member of the House Appropriations Committee
key_responsibilities: responsible for a portfolio of legislative/policy issue areas, with an emphasis on the environment, energy, agriculture, telecommunications, natural disasters/emergency management, science/space, trade, and labor
working with senior staff on new legislative proposals
drafting of memos and talking points for the Member
drafting of speeches and remarks on legislative portfolio topics
drafting, review, and management of related letters
coordination with communications and district staff on press events
stakeholder meetings and proactive outreach
liaising with relevant committees
developing and justifying co-sponsorship and vote recommendations
requirements: graduate degree in environmental studies or two to three years of environmental policy experience
ability to multitask and meet deadlines in a rigorous environment
Hill experience and Florida ties a plus

office: Ranking Democratic Member of the House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology
key_responsibilities: acting as the clerk for each hearing
communicating with Member offices
managing the front office
answering phones
hiring and managing interns
maintaining correspondence system and Committee records
assisting staff with research
executing other administrative duties as needed
requirements: ability to work under tight deadlines

key_responsibilities: managing the Member’s daily schedule
arranging travel
coordinating all Member level meetings and event requests
other duties as assigned
requirements: at least three years of experience as an executive assistant and/or scheduler/office manager
able to thrive in a fast paced work environment

key_responsibilities: responding to constituent mail
monitoring House floor procedures
assisting the legislative director with drafting legislation
meeting with constituents and interested individuals/organizations
preparing congressional record entries
assisting the communications director with updating the website and Facebook and Twitter pages
other duties as assigned
requirements: able to manage multiple tasks and work well under pressure
able to think outside the box
resident of, or be willing to become, a resident of the District of Columbia

office: Congressman Raul Ruiz, M.D. of California
key_responsibilities: assist constituents by navigating complex casework through federal agencies in areas such as veterans affairs, social security, housing, and immigration
assess casework and community activities for matters warranting legislative action
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills
prior experience working for state or local government a plus
fluency or strong verbal and written proficiency in Spanish preferred
strong knowledge or connection with Riverside County and California’s 36th Congressional District a plus
availability for evening and weekend assignments maybe required at times

office: Democratic Staff of the House Committee on Small Business
key_responsibilities: handle procurement policy, with an emphasis on small business contracting issues
requirements: subject matter experience in federal set-aside programs, federal agency buying practices, and federal acquisition policy is strongly preferred
experience with hearing preparation and legislative development a plus

office: Congressman Raul Ruiz, M.D. of California
key_responsibilities: assist constituents by navigating complex casework through federal agencies in areas such as veterans affairs, social security, housing, and immigration
assess casework and community activities for matters warranting legislative action
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills
prior experience working for state or local government a plus
fluency or strong verbal and written proficiency in Spanish preferred
strong knowledge or connection with Riverside County and California’s 36th Congressional District a plus
availability for evening and weekend assignments maybe required at times

position: Legislative Assistant, or Senior Legislative Assistant
key_responsibilities: handle work on the Financial Services Committee and other issues
requirements: substantial experience with financial services issues and substantial Congressional experience
strong writing and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: manage and coordinate all communications activities, including media contacts, for the Member and the office
requirements: at least 2 years of congressional experience and one year of experience as a Communications Director or Press Secretary
strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills
understanding of print and broadcast media with a current working list of Washington and national media contacts
knowledge of current issues and events in which the Member is involved
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Member's positions on policy issues
ability to work well under pressure
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with office staff, constituents, and media

office: A Western Republican member of Congress
key_responsibilities: Support the Representative’s legislative priorities through legislative research, the drafting of legislation, acting as the liaison to the relevant committees, work with the Congressional Research Service, and identifying strategies to advance those legislative priorities
Prepare the member for committee hearings, staff those hearings and monitor/report to the Representative at times when he is unable to attend the meeting
Assist the Representative in preparing for interviews, meetings with constituents and interest groups, as well as note taking at such meetings and follow up action items
Draft answers or prepare outlines of responses to constituent mail
Draft speeches, statements and correspondence with the appropriate executive agencies for review by the Legislative Director, Chief of Staff, and the Representative

Develop and justify co-sponsorship and vote recommendations for review by the Legislative Director and Chief of Staff and for consideration by the Representative for bills in committee, mark up and on the floor in assigned areas of responsibility

coordinating with the legislative team to develop, manage and organize all communications activities, including writing press releases, op-eds, mail pieces, talking points, organizing press events, maintaining the official website, implementing social media strategy, maintaining press database, writing e-newsletters & coordinating Tele-town halls
briefing the Member for interviews, writing and implementing PSAs, interacting with the press as the Member’s principal spokesperson and coordinating the Member’s overall press relations
requirements: proven ability to manage multiple communications projects
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Member’s position on policy issues
a depth of legislative and policy knowledge including that of the appropriations process
able to work extended hours, under time pressure, and in a strongly collaborative office, while maintaining a positive attitude and demeanor

office: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
key_responsibilities: participate in all matters under the Committee’s jurisdiction, including investigations, hearings, depositions, transcribed interviews, and briefings
requirements: attorney with 2-5 years of investigative or litigation experience
excellent written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: develop strategies to increase outreach to LES and represent the office at public meetings

office: Democratic Staff of the House Committee on Small Business
key_responsibilities: handle matters including but not limited to agency oversight, procurement, financial services, health, and/or technology
hearing preparation and legislative development
requirements: previous legislative experience is not necessary but preferred
